  7341. It does dry my fine, but thick shoulder length hair in about 7 mins.
  7342. A total waste of money - in this case, you really do get what you pay for!
  7343. Mostly because my arm was tired from holding it so long.
  7344. i love that it's lightweight and can dry my thick, curly, long hair in about 10 mins (which is about 20 mins faster than my last blow dryer) without causing frizzies (when using the diffuser, which was included, along with a concentrator) or my arms needing a break.
  7345. Dries my thick shoulder length hair quickly without scorching it.
  7346. I have EXTREMELY thick hair and this blow dryer works quickly and leaves my hear looking sleek.
  7347. and it dries my thick hair quickly with lots of shine and volume.
  7348. This dryer is lightweight and dries my thick hair quickly.
  7349. Dries really thick hair rather quickly without frizzing so much<br /><br
  7350. The only problem is that after only one month, when the dryer gets hot, it starts to smell, which worries me a little.
  7351. With my old dryer, I used the diffuser with the heat level on high and the fan speed on low, and my hair dried.
  7352. She wanted a powerful dryer that would cut down on time spent fixing her hair.
  7353. This has never happened to me with any other hair dryer before, even when I dry my hair the exact same way.
  7354. heats up very quickly, my hair is pretty thick and usually takes a while to dry, this dryer works very well for helping make the process less time consuming.
  7355. As a male with medium-length hair, I don't see how someone could recommend this particular product (compared to the 10 other options out there at c. $20) to anyone with longer-than-short hair.
  7356. My husband says both air flow speeds are too fast for him, but our old dryer was VERY old and he was use to the weak air flow.
  7357. a little too large to hold
  7358. This is much lighter and much less powerful than I expected from reading all the previous reviews.
  7359. Only problem i see is the wire is not long enough.<br />Good

  7361. but... the exact same thing that a few people below describe happened to me last night.
  7362. I give 3 stars because the wind is a little bit weak and kind of overheat.
  7363. I'm a 23 year old male who wanted a hair dryer to dry my feet after showering to prevent athletes foot (as reccommend by my podiatrist).
  7364. Even though you shouldn't dry your hair underneath near your face, this hair dryer's screen needs to be redesigned so this doesn't happen in the future.
  7365. In reading the reviews, I expected it to dry my hair much quicker.
  7366. My only complaint was that the screen protecting the fan in the back wasn't fine enough so my long hair would sometimes get pulled in.
  7367. The hunt for a good and not super expensive dryer continues!<br
  7368. I just wish it had a little more heat and power behind it for use on my long, straight, blonde hair.
  7369. OK, I could live with that, though it was very awkward, to say the least (isn't the point of a blow dryer to be able to move it around your head in different positions!?!? )
  7370. I turned it on the \\"high\\" and \\"warm\\" setting to get it 80% dry, then put the concentrator on and turned it down to \\"low\\" (it was drying too fast!)
  7371. The next day, it threw off large orange sparks and little sparks of, well, fire.
  7372. The high speed is about the same as the low speed of the other dryer.
  7373. Seems as if most things today, last much less lately.
  7374. To dry my hair in the past I would blow dry the top for about 20 minutes then go sit or do chores and let it air dry for at last 30 minutes.
  7375. and since I have long hair, the weight of it really made a difference compared to other dryers ive used.
  7376. so I really just needed a basic one for nights when I didn't want to go out with a wet head and wait for my hair to dry.
  7377. I have fine thin hair
  7378. I have extremely fine, thin below shoulder greying hair that is getting the menopausal straw texture.
  7379. If I had it to do over I would put the $20 towards another good quality hair dryer that won't end up looking like some weird melted mess.
  7380. This is definitely a bang-for-your-buck sort of product -- maybe it's not the flashiest, maybe it won't last long enough to be passed down to your grandkids, but in the meantime, it does exactly what you want it to.
  7381. With this Revlon dryer, it took me at least a good 15 minutes to fully dry my short, thick hair.
  7382. this dries my hair much faster than any other dryer I've owned (I have pretty thick hair), and it does make my hair shiney.
  7383. It is better than my 4 year old heavy conair,that was weak in power.
  7384. This hair dryer's &#34;wind pressure&#34; for lack of a better term, is very weak.
  7385. but about half way into my first blow dry, it sucked a piece of hair into the hinged end cap and zapped the hair and shorted out the highest speed.
  7386. Helps too for curls - they dry faster on hot with less movement.
  7387. My main concern is that the motor is not powerful enough.
  7388. but It dried my hair SUPER fast with the diffuser on, and I have very thick hair that normally takes forever to dry.
  7389. but it's a solid little thing that can really do its job.
  7390. />Since I wasn't a regular hair dryer user when I ordered this, it didn't inconvenience me so much that this product took a little over a month to arrive.
  7391. I have had trouble finding a hair dryer with enough power to dry my long hair quickly without also weighing fifty pounds.
  7392. It doesn't just blow air into my hair, it blows my hair around and gets it dry much faster than other hairdryers.
  7393. It seems to dry my hair quicker than other blow driers, and doesn't seems to be causing much damage.
  7394. The off/ on button is so much easier to operate with one hand while the other hand dry or style the hair.
  7395. With my old dryer I would take about 15 to 20 minutes to get my hair dry with this one i am done in 10 minutes flat
  7396. My fine, straight hair is normally no big deal to style but this dryer leaves it limp, limp, limp.
  7397. My other hair dryer was a very old Gillette blow dryer.
  7398. After reading the other one star reviews, I guess I'm lucky this thing didn't blow up in my face or melt anything, plus I got a whole 14 months of use out of it before it died--just sort of acted like it got really tired and shut off--
  7399. This large handheld hair dryer is loud and takes a little too long to dry hair.
  7400. It recently broke (entirely my fault, I dropped it from high up onto a hard floor), and I immediately rushed to buy a new one to replace it.
  7401. And after the cold shot button it was amazing.
  7402. This is the only hair dryer I have ever bought, and as it dries my hair in a reasonable amount of time and has not broken, shocked me, or burnt me, I declare it a success.
  7403. The back opens for cleaning...remember to clean it by flipping open the round black vent in the back-

All Reviews

  1. Used it for about 6 months and loved it, no complaints. Then it just stopped working.
  2. So far, so good. While I read that some people had problems with this hair dryer, I had purchased it before, and that one lasted 4 1/2 years. Considering the price, and the fact that I returned one (to a drug store, not to Amazon) that cost more than twice the price and didn't work nearly as well, I decided to take my chances. It dries hair quickly without breakage. I did notice that now on the info they include, it tells you not to wrap the cord around the handle for storage. I always did that, although I never pulled it tight to where it broke the wires or covering on them, so maybe that contributed to the problem people have had? Seems to be well made. I will update this review if it breaks quickly.
  3. Don't buy! After using it for a little over 6 months mine suddenly caught on fire.<br />It stopped working, sparkles came out of the handle, the electric cord caught on fire. I was able to unplug it.<br />The sparkles damaged my wall bathroom mirror. But at least I didn't die from electrocution!
  4. I've used this dryer several times, and it is faster and quieter than my previous (deceased) hair dryer. My hair gets dryer faster, plus the Revlon dryer is very light, making it so easy to use without straining my arms for so long. I haven't used attachments on a blow dryer in so long, I almost forgot what a convenience they are. In truth, I tossed out my old dryer's attachments because they kept popping off while the dryer was working. No such problem here -- the attachments seem to snap securely into place and stay there until they are removed! Excellent price for a dryer that performs this well. I may ultimately purchase a second one for the guest bathroom.
  5. I liked this Revlon hair dryer as it dried my hair quickly and was relatively lightweight. I'm on my third one though within a year. It only takes my hair 5 minutes to blow dry, once daily. This hair dryer should last much longer. I'm on my search for another dryer.
  6. This hair dryer is great and cheap. I don't use one all the time but when I do I expect it to make my hair dry and not hot. This dryer does not damage my hair and it's still in great shape. My only concern is it smells pretty bad like something is burnt when I turn it on but it doesn't bother me because I understand it has to heat up.
  7. It is not terrible but I would not buy it again. It seems like over time ( and not a long time) the dryer has lost some of its air power. I thought it used to actually move my hair while I was drying it now it does not. It blows two temperatures of hot air and the cold shot still works, I have cleaned the filters out but it just takes forever to dry my med length hair. I want a blow dryer that BLOWS the hair. This one does not. The other issue I have is with the design. The toggle switch power is right where you hold the dryer so I am CONSTANTLY turning it off accidentally while drying.
  8. I have been using the hairdryer for a while and everything had been working fine. Yesterday however, after blow drying for about 5 minutes, I noticed it started to lose power. I thought I simply had to clean the filter, but before I managed to reach up and turn it off there were sparks and smoke coming out from both the outlet and blow dryer itself. As this was right where I held my hand, I dropped it in panic and unplugged it immediately. In the split second that the dryer ignited, the palm of my hand had turned black from the smoke. Most of this washed away, but I was left with a painful burn that has yet to go away. Upon closer inspection I noticed that the cable had broken where it connects to the dryer, and reading other reviews this seems to be a common problem. I have never bent the wire at this point, as I consistently hang it using the attached hook. This must simply be bad engineering, and seeing how this could be dangerous (even potentially lethal), I cannot recommend this hair dryer to anyone else.
  9. Needed a new hair dryer. Read many reviews for this dryer and I have to agree with the positive reviews. This hair dryer is very impressive.
  10. Awesome blow dryer, I wish I had chosen the travel one. Next time. It's excellent.

  82. I really like this hair dryer. It's affordable and works great! I have long, very thick, semi-straight hair and this is able to dry my hair in about 3 minutes. I debated purchasing a more expensive model for the guarantee of better quality (of course that's not always the case), but from my research, this model is just as high-powered and well-reviewed as the more expensive brands. I find that for straight hair, you can save on the dryer but splurge on a good-quality straightener. Likewise you should save on the shampoo (it's all basically the same ingredients) but splurge on a good conditioner. I've found that this makes all the difference for getting smooth, straight hair.
  83. I have had a Conair dryer for many years but it finally broke. After reading many reviews I chose the Revlon Tourmaline dryer. It really does dry my hair in half the time, and it looks extra shiny.
  84. This large handheld hair dryer is loud and takes a little too long to dry hair. I've had smaller ones that were more powerful and less noisy, but went for it because it looked like a bargain. If the diffuser attachment is important to you, that could cinch the deal. I found the attachment to be entirely ineffective, but it might work if you drape really long hair onto it. Ionic - this product is marketed as ionic. It has an ion indicator light. The Revlon website doesn't list this product, and I couldn't find anywhere a claim to the effect that it imparts a negative charge to the air. It's reasonable to expect Revlon to state whether it has an emitter and leaves only negative ions in the exhaust. Unfortunately, quality handheld hair dryers cost a lot more. You have to look at this as a value purchase, and because it's so large, you should have the space for it.
  85. I torched my other Ionic while traveling overseas. This was a great replacement for it. Works well, and I like the low setting the best. Just enough to allow me to dry my hair enough to go outside and not let the wind have it's way with my hair :-)
  86. my hair is shoulder length, layered and medium thick. My old dryer (Remington D-2012 Tstudio Collection Tourmaline and Ceramic Hair Dryer) took 5-10 minutes to dry my hair. This dryer took 5-7.   88. I use this dryer with a universal diffuser attachment and love the way it works. The air doesn't blow too fast on the low setting. I have very thick, above the shoulder-length hair. My hair is wavy/has big curls. This blow dryer, plus a diffuser attachment, works great for me. Oh, and on the low setting, it's not too loud!

It has been compared to more expensive products with similar technology, but did not produce the same results whatsoever (I previously owned a high-end dryer that died after 5 years and did a very nice job while alive). Further, this dryer got so hot while drying my hair that it once literally burned my palm. It consistently emitted a horrible burning smell. Finally, it abruptly stopped working after 2 1/2 months, probably due to how hot it got. I am surprised and lucky that it didn't catch on fire (yes, I should have returned it right away, but got caught up in life). I consider this a dangerous product which deserves zero stars. Sometimes you really do get what you pay for.

There was no burnt plastic smell so I don't think the motor had anything to do with the failure. I had two days where the dryer cut off and when I jiggled the cord it would come back on and continue working. Until day three when it just quit altogether. Obviously there is an issue with the cord and it having a short in it that causes the dryer to stop working. Interestingly enough the handy tab for hanging the blow dryer on a hook is located with the cord and where it attaches to the dryer. Likely hanging the blow dryer by this tab is what caused the error in my case. I bought this because of the reviews and the Revlon brand of quality. Very disappointed.

It dries faster than my expensive ionic dryer and my hair looks and feels different, too....softer, shinier and styled the way I like it.

  133. Works well. Dries my thick shoulder length hair quickly without scorching it. I am pleased.
  134. As an electrician I am somewhat qualified to review why this hairdryer fails and is a danger. My hairdryer failed to last a year because the cord just under the strain relief has severed internally under the rubber from mechanical fatigue. When this happens the dryer will lose power and regain power if you flex the cord, eventually if you keep using it, the arcing at the break will overheat and the cord will: smoke, burn, pop, expose the conductors and maybe catch on fire. All they need to do is use a higher quality cord, otherwise this dryer would be fine. As it is, it's a hazard that is not worth it.
  135. I don't understand how anyone found this hairdryer to be too big. I am a short chick with short arms and I can easily hold this away from my head with out any trouble. It gets the job done quickly !
  136. it was good while it lasted. 6 months in something in the heat function broke and it didn't work as well as it originally did. About a year in the whole dryer broke. It will now live in a landfill for millions of years...
  137. I was not happy with this dryer and am returning it. It is very loud, the diffuser attachment is very small and the hot setting was not hot enough for me. I have very thick, very curly hair (just below shoulder length) and diffuse my hair every day. The diffuser that came as an attachment is much smaller and is flat and has the fingers sticking out, which ended up poking my head. The Helen of Troy diffuser I've used for years has a bigger circumference and is concave so the fingers don't touch your head. Also, most ionic dryers leave your hair shiny, but this dryer left my hair frizzy and dull. I also wish it had a longer cord. On the hottest heat setting, it just felt like the ends of my hair were getting dry, not my roots. For curly hair, if you don't get the roots dry, you end up with flat hair that is curly on the bottom a.k.a. \\"triangle head.\\" On the up side, it is very light. Someone with thin or straight hair may really like it. But if you have thick, curly hair...this dryer is mostly just noise.
  138. i bought this hair dryer for the second bathroom, and it's now in our master bathroom. lightweight, quick hair dryer. clean, simple design. functions are pretty standard. i'm not sure if the tourmaline ionic really does what it claims, but the price was about the same as other models without the feature, so i figured i might as well get it. my only (slight)complaint is that it has rocker switches instead of slider switches. sometimes when you're shaking the dryer around, you can inadvertantly shut the unit off. no big deal, but it is a drawback. otherwise, excellent product.
  139. Amidst the happy reviews there are just a few that mention that this might not be a good dryer for fine hair. Wish I'd listened! And perhaps because my hair is both fine and short, the dryer runs too hot for me. Can't handle pain before breakfast. Glad it works well for so many folks but, for me, time to find another dryer. I strongly recommend the Elchim Professional 2001 2000 Watt Classic Hair Dryer, which is not ionic, works perfectly with my fine hair, and has proved worth the higher price.

  160. My husband bought this dryer for me for Christmas. I have very thick, curly/wavy shoulder length hair. With previous dryers I would take forever blowdrying my hair only to have it frizz, then I'd have to use a flat iron. Eventually, I got fed up with trying to style my hair and just let my hair \\"go natural\\". I talked to my hairdresser who suggested an ionic/tourmaline dryer. My husband picked this one because of the good reviews. Well, the first time I used it I was amazed. My hair looked as good as it does when I leave the salon and dried very quickly. Another big plus was that the dryer was very light. Previously, my arms would get tired and my neck and shoulders would hurt (I have muscle spasms in this area) trying to dry and style my hair but not with this dryer. It also eliminated the need for a flat iron which really cut down on time spent on my hair. Other reviewers said the dryer was noisy and the buttons were difficult to control but I haven't noticed a problem with either issue. The buttons took a little time to get used to but once I used the dryer a few times, it was fine. Also, the only attachment I have used is the concentrator so I can't comment on the diffuser This hairdryer truly is amazing. I even got my hair cut into a trendier style now that I can control it. If you looking for a dryer that will make styling your hair easier, faster and make your hair look healthier, thiis is it!

I don't use the round black thing but use the intensifier nozzle a lot. The button placement could be better but what the heck, it's only a hair dryer not an instrument for brain surgery.   193. I'm a long-time Amazon buyer - but don't write many reviews. My review now is by happen-stance as I was poking around in \\"my account\\" options and was reviewing what I had purchased over the years and came across this purchase in 2006. Can't recommend this dryer enough ( and yes - perhaps the newer models have changed in appearance/button location). Bottom line - hair dries in much, much less time and this dryer is still going steady after 3 years of use. You can pay $75.00 ---> on up if you choose to buy another dryer because you can't handle where the buttons are located on this dryer. So do what ever floats the boat. But for my money and the same results - you can't find a better dryer anywhere for this price.
  194. I've had this dryer for about two years, and it held up pretty well during that time. Recently, it started making a burning smell, and regular cleaning of the lint area hasn't helped, so I figured it was time to replace the unit.<br /><br />I originally bought this Revlon unit here on Amazon since it was rated as a Consumer Digest Best Buy, and it's a decent dryer for the price. If you have shorter hair that is not too thick, this dryer should be fine.<br /><br />That being said, instead of buying a new one of these to replace my old one, I decided to upgrade to a Sedu brand dryer -- and the difference between the two is amazing. With this Revlon dryer, it took me at least a good 15 minutes to fully dry my short, thick hair. The Sedu dryer dries my hair in less than five minutes.<br /><br />If you want a good, mid-priced dryer, than this Revlon works well and will last a long time. However, if you want a faster drying time, I wouldn't recommend this one. I didn't know how slow this thing was until I splurged on a more expensive unit.<br /><br />Overall, I would give this Revlon unit 3 1/2 stars.
  195. Works great, dries my hair MUCH faster than my previous dryer... or any dryer I have ever used outside of a salon. I am completely satisfied with it, ESPECIALLY for the GREAT price (I got mine for $16.99). Yes, as some reviews mention... it does get very hot on High, (but I have a lot of hair so maybe thats why it's not a big deal to me). Yes, the power control buttons are placed stupidly/as rocker buttons, but that is also not a deal-breaker for me either. -So once in a while I shut it off or accidentally change it's setting, big deal! I then turn it back on or flip it back to high! It's not particularly frustrating. I researched and researched hairdryer's before I made the decision to buy this one several months ago after my old dryer broke. This was the one I found, and back then it was $30+. I ended up discovering how to fix my old dryer, and so it wasn't' until I lost my old dryer moving that I actually went ahead and bought this one around Christmas. It was a great choice!
  196. I have thick hair, so I need a hairdryer with some serious power and heat. This model is much better than my last hairdryer. It only has two heat settings, but that's all I really need. I sometimes accidentally turn it off because of where the on/off switch is, but it takes 0.5 seconds to turn it back on so who cares. It doesn't just blow air into my hair, it blows my hair around and gets it dry much faster than other hairdryers. It's light so my arm doesn't get tired. I haven't had problems with it sucking my hair into the intake vent either. I've had it for more than a year, and if it dies, I'll get another one. Highly recommend!

Wasn't too familiar with Tourmaline or what it did, but I noticed everyone had it now, so why not...<br />So to add on to the other reviews- I have VERY long (thigh length) hair. The hair itself is fine, but there's alot of it, so it takes a long time to dry, and I blow dry every day. My first purchases were duds. Too heavy, too long to dry, too hot...I felt like I couldn't get it right.<br />For the small price of this dryer, I figured I'd try it. Indeed, it's well constructed, very light to hold, and comes with the big diffuser attachment you see in the pic, and a smaller mouth attachment for focused drying. I almost want to buy a second one and hide it away for when this one eventually blows up, so I don't have to search for a perfect replacement like this again! I tried several different brands and price ranges before I bought this, and I have to say price is the only difference. It's a tad loud on the highest level, but all of the dryers were, so I couldn't take off a star for that!<br />Just be careful to buy the RV544. There are MANY different Revlon dryers out there, and they are ALL DIFFERENT! I tried a few! This is the one you want.

I thought the GFCI was tripped so I pressed the button...that was not the issue. I then tried the power switch again and a huge spark and smoke came from the area where the cord enters the dryer. My first instinct was to unplug the unit and I'm glad I did. Turned out the unit shorted at that point and burned completely through the cord and insulation. Very dangerous and could have easily caused an electrocution if someone inadvertently grabbed that area instead. I never wrapped the cord around the unit or subjected it to falls or other abuse. Revlon's warranty policy is ridiculous. They want the buyer to send the unit back as well as $6 to cover handling. By the time someone does this it would have cost more than the unit. MY ONLY ADVICE IS JUST TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS UNIT AND LOOK ELSEWHERE...THIS IS A BAD PRODUCT AND COULD CAUSE HARM TO SOMEONE!!!

  215. I purchased this item to replace an ancient, 1980's-era blow dryer, and based my choice on its excellent reviews. I have to agree, this is an excellent product. I thought this might be a problem, but actually it is an advantage as it won't burn you if you leave it in one place too long. The volume of air being pushed out of this dryer is far stronger than my old hair dryer, so it dries very fast. I have naturally wavy hair that tends to frizz and I used the dryer to straighten it. Much to my surprise, this dryer not only dried my hair very quickly, it left it very smooth with no frizz. It must be the lower heat with the strong blast of air that works so well. This has been a major relief to my daughter, who was sick of me spending so much time looking at my hair.<br /><br />Fourth, I always have had static problems with my hair in the winter time, no matter what products I used in it.   239. It turns on, heats, blows, etc.<br /><br />The problem I have with this hair dryer is that it DOES NOT have a filter that can be removed and cleaned. This is the one and only thing that could extend the life of the hair dryer. Such a thing would cost less than a penny. This is a huge oversight by the manufacturer. While the &#34;end cap&#34; may be removed and cleaned it is NOT a filter. The end cap will not keep dust and lint out of the dryer. There is a screen underneath the end cap, but it is not removable.<br /><br />I took the filter out of my last dryer and installed it. The filter is not paper. It is plastic. It is a finer mesh than the mesh on the back of the this dryer but does not reduce the airflow.<br /><br />I hope the manufacturer reads this: Please add a removeable filter to your hairdryers.

  273. This was my first Tourmaline hair dryer. So I can't compare it with anything. I have thick middle-eastern hair that gets frizzy when I blow-dry it. But I was very happy with this dryer until the fan stopped working after 10 months gentle use (twice a week). Pros: ---------- - It gets very hot (you can burn your hand if you touch your hair after drying it with this dryer). So it dries hair very fast. - It's light-weight. - It was much quieter than my previous Revlon dryer, before the fan started making loud noises. - It left my hair silky and very soft. Cons: ---------- - Stopped working after 10 months gentle use (at most twice a week)! - It's too long to use with the diffuser attachment on your own hair, unless you have very long arms! - The heat melted the concentrator attachment after a few months. Hopefully it didn't ruin my hair. - Due to its length, it's hard to fit into your suitcase; something you might want to consider if you travel a lot like I do. Over all, I won't buy this again. I'm going to try something else this time. (I had bought mine from Walgreens, but it was the same product and for the same price.)
  274. This hair dryer works very well for me. It is very affordable and comes with extra attachments if needed for added styling.
  275. I purchased the dryer after reading all those great revues. And I'm absolutely happy with my purchase. It's very light, and it's really important for me as my hair drys very much slower, comparing to other people I know. The dryer is also very powerful. In other words I purchased I really good dryer for a really affordable price, I'm more than happy.
  276. Perfect replacement for my hairdryer that was dying and price was right.
  277. Began working intermittingly after only 8 months of use. The issue is a loose connection in the cord brought on when you hang the dryer from the tab on the handle. Hanging it this way causes the cord to bend in a way that must, over time, loosen the connection inside the dryer. I'm stretching out its life by using electrical tape to reinforce the cord position but the dryer clearly has a design flaw.
  278. This is the best hairdryer at this price! It's bigger than I expected from the picture, which is good. Totally worth buying! I love it.

One thing I wasn't expecting was how great my hair would look and feel afterward; usually, after drying, my hair is coarse and wavy and I have to take a flat iron to it. After using the ionic dryer, my hair is smooth and shiny; no need for the straightener!

I use the hot setting and it does not damage my hair what so ever. It is a really great dryer. It is light and the cord is long enough for you to use without incident. I would recommend this to anyone! UPDATE: A few weeks ago I was drying my hair as usual when the hairdryer sparked what looked like fireworks on the fourth of July and started smoking. I was totally freaked out and somewhat angry, so I emailed the Revlon customer service and asked about a warranty. Within a day or so I received a phone call from Helen of Troy, the company that produces the dryer asking if I was okay and which model I had. Without question they had FedEx-ed me a brand new hair dryer in 2 business days. I was really impressed with their customer service. I am sure I just had a faulty dryer, I still use mine every other day and it is amazing.

  328. Reasons why I love this product:<br /><br />1) It's VERY lightweight. I hadn't replaced my hair dryer in many years, and this is a noticeable improvement. It's also nice because it won't take up much weight in my luggage.<br /><br />2) The attachments actually fit OVER the nozzle instead of clipping right inside, so they actually stay in place. I had a previous hair dryer where the diffuser fit into the inside rim of the nozzle, and it kept falling out all the time. These attachments fit over the nozzle and are very sturdy, so no more worrying about the diffuser falling off when you're drying your hair upside down.<br /><br />3) The hot setting is REALLY hot, and the cold setting is actually cold. Not true with all hair dryers, in my experience.<br /><br />Bottom line: highly recommended!
  329. This is a decent hair dryer that is simple to use and does what it is suppose to do. Drying hair is not complicated and it does that. The warranty is for two years and Revlon will replace it for $5 when you ship it back to them. So if I spend $12 to return it and include $5 to cover the return shipping I will have saved $3 under the Amazon price. I doubt if they get many returns. This one was purchased 54 weeks ago and used daily by my wife, so it barely made it half way through the warrantiy period. Without the $5 charge then a return might be in order. I won't buy another Revlon.

I didn't experiment a lot because it's a long walk to the breaker box in the garage, but I assume the lower power setting wouldn't blow the breaker. I based my choice on users' reviews of this dryer. I wanted three features and got one of them. I wanted a light-weight dryer and it IS light. I wanted quiet. Several reviews said it was, but it is quite a bit louder than my old Sassoon. I wanted the fast-drying that several reviewers praised. I haven't timed it, but I don't sense that it dries my (thick, medium-length) hair faster than the old one.

I have dreadlocks which hold a lot of water after washing so, I needed something powerful that could completely dry my hair or come as close to that as possible. This dryer satisfies my needs,it's powerful and even with long hair I do not need to use it at the highest settings to get good results. At the highest setting it's very bearable and not uncomfortably hot to the ears or other parts of the face. However,if you have clips or some other metal item in your hair those can get very hot and that can be a bit painful. As long as you focus the dryer on your hair it's good.<br /><br />The only problem I have with the dryer is the placement of the control buttons. Based on the way that I have to hold the dryer I'm either turning it off or changing the settings while I'm using it which is a bit of a nuisance. I know that most dryers are like this but I've never had a problem like this one before. I'm not sure if it's the style of the buttons but they switch very easily, which can be a good thing when starting it up but can be a problem while in use.<br /><br />All in all for the price it's an excellent dryer.

  370. Purchased this hair dryer a long time ago and never thought of writing a review until now. The item is several years old and still holding up well. I'm very pleased with my purchase!
  371. after reading plenty of reviews on amazon and on other websites, i decided to purchase this hair dryer. i wanted something that dried my hair quickly, but had this new fangled tourmaline gem thing, as well as something ionic or ceramic for even heating. i dry my hair with a dryer every time i wash it, so any features that decrease chances of me frying my hair are a plus. i usually go for conair, but this dryer has gotten a lot of positive reviews, so i went for revlon this time! 1. dries quickly, but no scalding! i have thick asian hair and have been using 1875 watt dryers for at least a decade (how else can i dry my hair under an hour?). it does tend to get pretty toasty, as some other reviews noted, but it's not more than other hairdryers i've owned. i never keep it in one spot, nor do i think you're supposed to, so burning myself hasn't been an issue at all. the cord doesn't get hot during use. (i checked after i finished drying my hair.) also, the barrel doesn't get very hot, either. immediately after using it, i felt the barrel and it was relatively cool. i could probably hold onto it while styling. 2. noise level. honestly, it's not that much quieter than my last dryer before it broke, but i think the last one was designed to be quiet, too. (i've had it for a while so i don't remember) also, it's a different kind of loud. it is definitely not as loud as some other hair dryer's i've tried, so i would consider it quiet... especially on the lower settings. the loudness mainly comes from the amount of air blowing through, which is not as bad. it's bad when a dryer is loud because the fan has that high machine whine or sounds like a lawn mower. this one is just a lot of air whooshing through. 3. weight. Definitely light!! love it. 4. attachments. sorry, i don't really use them, but they seem like your typical diffuser and concentrator. 5. the tourmaline/ionic thing. works great as far as i can tell! my hair feels super soft after i use it! it feels light. also, not to be gross, but it doesn't make my head all sweaty after i use it, either. haven't used it during the summer yet, but it's been better than my last dryer at that! i've never really used any of the expensive dryers, so i can't compare, but for this price range, it's definitely a five-star! hope it lasts as long as my last one :)
  372. This hairdryer was a steal for twenty bucks!! I definitely feel like I'm using a dryer worth a lot more. My *thick*, wavy hair dries much faster now than with previously owned dryers. All the settings work as expected, including the cool setting (a first for me - they seem to usually just be decoration with no real function.) I would purchase this again in a heartbeat.
  373. Quality is so so. The design is a little strange since the Off is the middle switch which makes it uncomfortable to turn off easily.

  472. I'd been looking to replace my 20-plus year old black & decker hair dryer which I hung on to due to its light weight & low noise level, I have sensitive ears & loud noise is like being tortured. The old hair dryer finally gave out I chose this after reading other reviews this really is a quiet & light hair dryer you will not be disappointed with this purchase.

  476. I was a skeptic when it came to hairdryers--they all blow air into your hair and it dries, right? Not so! The technology in this hair dryer is tourmaline ionic, meaning it reduces static, frizz, and boosts shine. I had a vidal sassoon before, and a Conair before that, and they were supposedly \\"ionic\\" but my hair was still quite a bit frizzy afterwards. This Revlon is amazing, though--my hair is so straight, sleek, and shiny, without having to apply a bunch of creams or shining sprays. It saves a lot of time! It comes with two attachments (diffuser, concentrator)--I've only used the concentrator to straighten my hair and it takes around six minutes and works effectively. Also, a HUGE bonus is its lightweight! The comparable Conair version (nearly same price, ionic) is so so much heavier, while this hairdryer is easy to move, so I can pick it up and use it all over my hair. The only con about this as others have mentioned is that you have to hold it carefully or else your fingers will accidentally turn the hairdryer off--the buttons move easily and are near where you place your fingers to hold it. Bottom Line: This is the best hairdryer for the price. When I used other hairdryers, my hair is very noticeably frizzier and less shiny compared to this Revlon. It's a reasonable price for the technology, and I definitely recommend it!!
  477. I was looking for a new dryer and found this one. It is very light and not very loud. The diffuser is huge which can be bad if you travel a lot like me, or have limited storage space. The ionic part works well. My hair is less frizzy and have lot of natural curl so I usually have frizz when I blow dry my hair. Why I returned it was that it the 2 heat settings were not good for me. The \\"warm\\" was actually hot and the\\" hot\\" was way too hot for my fine delicate hair. Back to the drawing board.

Suddenly I smelled hair burning, and in what seemed like an instant, I realized that my hair had been badly burnt, the natural bristled brush had burned on the ends, and there was lots of burned hair in it. I had to leave the hair dryer in UK as it wasn't worth it to try and fit it in my suitcase, but I would not trust this dryer, at least not to use in another country.   514. I have owned this hair dryer for just under 18 months. During that time I have used it, on average, 5-6 times per week and up until about a week ago, I loved it. It dries quickly without getting too hot, the diffuser (which I use regularly on my naturally curly hair) fits snugly without falling off, it has settings for heat and airflow that can be set independently of each other, and it seems to help keep my curly hair smoother and less frizzy. It is also much lighter than other hair dryers I have used in the past, helping to reduce arm and hand fatigue, especially during a period of longer use, such as when I'm straightening my hair.<br /><br />This was my favorite hair dryer ever...until it abruptly stopped about 60 seconds into use one morning a week ago. I reset the plug and the outlet and when that didn't work, I asked my husband to take a look at it. He figured out that if you tweaked the cord in a certain way, the dryer would run again. The problem seemed to be in the 1.5&#34; long thicker area of cord where it attaches to the dryer. There is no visible fraying or damage on the exterior of the cord, but now the only way I can get the dryer to run is to hold the cord in a certain position and sometimes to pinch or slightly bend it in that thicker area just below the base of the dryer. I've been limping along like that, continuing to use it for the last week.<br /><br />I came to the Amazon website today to look up the date I had purchased the dryer and saw multiple reviews reporting problems like what I'm experiencing. However, I was dismayed to read that in several cases, once the cord began to experience this fault, the dryer has burned users or even caught on fire! As much as I loved this hair dryer, I'm not willing to risk a serious burn or an electrical fire to continue using it. I'm very disappointed in the durability and quality of this product and concerned about the safety hazard that it poses! I expected better from a large and well-knownbrand like Revlon.<br /><br />Based on how much I liked this product when it worked, I'd give it five stars, but I don't think I'd take a chance on buying another given the short useful life and the safety hazards it poses, hence my final one star rating.

  563. About four months after purchasing this hair dryer, which left my hair looking dry and brittle, it started turning on and off intermittently while in use. I had to twist the cord with one hand to make the wires connect while trying to use the hairdryer with the other. One day I got a nasty electrical shock when I turned it on, and it started sparking. I took it apart at some point before I threw it out to see if I could fix it, and it turns out that their \\"Ionic/tourmaline technology\\" translates to the hot air being blown through a cardboard toilet paper tube that has been spray-painted gold. Apparently gold paint = tourmaline? I think not. Do NOT buy this product. It is falsely advertised and a fire hazard.

Called up Helen of Troy, since it is still under a 2-year product warranty. However, to get a new dryer I'd need to ship in the old one, write a $5 check, and wait another 7-10 days processing time before they ship out. Plus, if they don't have the RV544 dryer in stock (which they can't tell you on the phone), they'll send you a different model, who knows which kind. (mailing address: 1 Helen of Troy Plaza; El Paso, TX 79912) Sp one way shipping fare, plus $5, plus 2+ weeks processing time does not equal a stellar reason to use the warranty, so I'm just purchasing a new one with my Amazon Prime account. Overall unfortunate customer service experience from Helen of Troy.

I recommend that you use a heat protectant before drying to keep your hair in the best possible condition. I've been a hairdresser since 1993.

  601. I am a hair stylist and during the middle of a very busy Saturday my over 2 yr old T3 went quiet and was not putting out any heat. Knowing I had to have another hair dryer by the middle of the week I went into action finding a replacement. I stumbled upon this hair dryer and many reviews claiming it's qualities and how much it is a less expensive T3 with all the same qualities as the T3- WRONG! It does not dry the hair as well, causes a lot more friziness, takes a very long time to dry hair, the cord is MUCH TOO MUCH too short, weighs more, is louder, and just does not leave the hair looking as shiny. I am really disappointed with it and all the reviews (on many websites) that made it sound like something it is not. In the dryer's defense; I know it is NOT a professional dryer and it was simply a quick fix until I could get another T3 and if I were to just use it at home I would probably be quite happy with it not expecting \\"professional\\" results. There is a CLEAR difference in the results from one to the other. Again, I know it is not a \\"professional\\" hair dryer so I would say the average person leaving behind a regular (non ionic or tourmaline) hair dryer will definitely see the difference once they start using this dryer but for me, a professional who puts a lot of effort into blow dries, it was \\"ok\\" until I got my T3 back!

  610. Purchased this about a year ago based on the &#34;#1 seller&#34; designation and good price. I was disappointed in the performance pretty much immediately, as it seemed to lack the power of the dryer it was replacing. This doesn't matter as much for me, as I have a shorter hairstyle, but it did matter for my wife. Also, despite the dryer categorized as being Tourmaline Ionic Ceramic, which is supposed to use a type of heat that doesn't over dry your hair or create frizz/static, I felt like this product produced a dry type of heat that did just that. Therefore a few days ago I looked around Amazon and ordered a different brand that will hopefully perform better.<br /><br />Now the bigger issue - The very next morning after ordering the new blowdryer, my wife was using this Revlon and was freaked out when it suddenly started sparking and smoking in her hand. And when I say sparking, I mean she said there were sparks showering out of the unit. Luckily she got the dryer unplugged, but not before it burned through half the cord. I was in there immediately after this incident and could smell the burned rubber. I set out to write a review and now see that many of the other negative reviews had the same scary situation with the dryer nearly exploding or catching fire during use. You would think that based on the frequency there would be a recall on this model. This dryer was an underachiever before it blew up, but now, with the safety hazard factor, I would urge anyone looking at this model to steer clear. There are plenty of other $20.00 hair dryers that do not carry a risk of injury or fire, so why take a risk?

  657. I got this item because I'm going away for college and I needed a new dryer but didn't want to pay a lot for it. I am mixed race and have wavy to slightly curly hair that's prone to frizz. This dryer is easy to use and came with attachments that are useful and work well (even heat distribution and I've noticed less frizz). They can be a little difficult to remove at first. Cord is a good length and the dryer is light weight. My arms weren't tired (usually takes about 30 minutes to completely dry my hair). The hatch at the back is hinged for easy cleaning and it has straight forward settings. Only problem that I have with the switches is that depending on you grip you can accidentally switch settings or turn the dryer off. Cool button is in a good spot and can be easily held down. To stay on cool setting longer I recommend putting heat setting on warm instead of hot. Over all a great deal at around $20.

Overall, I would recommend this dryer, especially if you don't want to spend the money on a T3. I like the diffuser attachments that come with it as well. The high setting is way to hot and the warm setting is not quite hot enough. The plastic casing is too smooth and slips in my hand.   678. I have very curly hair (pencil-sized curls) that I tend to straighten very often during the colder months. I decided to try this 'ionic' dryer because it is supposedly healthier for hair compared to a regular blow dryer. It comes with a concentrator attachment as well as a diffuser attachment, which I only used once and it works fine from what I remember but I do not wear my hair curly. I use it with the [[ASIN:B0002YE8V6 Vidal Sassoon VS7963 Ionic Thermal All Purpose Brush]] that I purchased together with it and they make a very good team for blowing my hair out as long as I comb my curls out beforehand, because the pins on the brush otherwise cause tangles. The brush purposely heats up, allowing the underside of the hair being blown to receive an equal amount of heat also, so I guess it is useful. Compared to every other blow dryer I have ever used in life, I definitely believe this is the best one I've used and I am satisfied enough that I would rather repurchase this one than try another brand. I'm not sure if it is the quality of the dryer itself or the 'ionic' technology (I haven't tried any other 'ionic' dryer before) but I notice that, as promised, my hair is healthier feeling than it usually would feel after blow drying it. Whereas most blow dryers leave a certain level of brittleness to my hair, this blow dryer actually leaves my hair in a condition comparable to that of my hair when I allow it to air dry naturally. My most important comment to make about this dryer is that it is very hot, I will consider that a good thing. The settings are Warm and Hot but I am never able to use the Hot because the Warm is already as hot as I can take it. I am able to use the Hot setting on my ends but I cannot put that heat anywhere near my scalp. I do not consider the temperature as a bad thing though because when I use the Cool Shot on the Warm setting it becomes room temperature, and it is easy to hold the Cool Shot button for the entire drying time if desired. It isvery light weight and relatively quiet especially when compared to an average blow dryer. I would equate its weight to that of a full bottle of conditioner; very light. I have had this dryer for nearly 2 years now and it still works like it did when it was brand new. I've already gotten my money's worth for the low price that it cost, and I expect to get at least another couple of years worth of use out of it.
  679. Dependable blow dryer. Fast drying and cost effective!
  680. Second one of this style I've purchased, LOVE it!
  681. Worked great for 6 months, then sparked and died. Almost set my hair on fire.

  758. This is a great dryer and the price makes it even better since it's performance compares really well with the more expensive dryers. I have shoulder length relaxed hair with fine strands & medium density and I was able to dry my hair using the warm heat & hi fan speed combo in around 15 minutes. It left my hair silky smooth & full of body and best of all ... my arm wasn't tired!! You've probably guessed already, but my favourite feaures about this dryer are: - lightweight - it actually is light compared to other dryers - the dual settings - they allow you to combine the desired heat setting (hot/warm) with the fan speed (hi/low). This is great for people like me who absolutely cannot stand a hot dryer but don't have the patience with the diminished air flow of the lower settings. - ionic technology - leaves your hair so smooth and shiny with lots of body and anyone with my type of hair knows that achieving volume is a minor miracle all by itself. - design - fits comfortably in your hand, the buttons are easy to get to and well placed so that you don't accidentally change the setting. It also has a hinged endcap to make cleaning the unit easy, which I'm sure I'll appreciate after I've had it a while.

  761. OWNED: 4 years. [Edited on 2014]<br /><br />MY HAIR: Wavy, average thickness hair.<br /><br />NOISE: High setting is noisy, but that is expected. Low setting is still somewhat noisy, but quiet enough that I can use it at night without feeling like I disrupt people in other rooms. If you worry too much about noise, you are going to buy a weak hair dryer that never dries you hair. Don't worry about noise.<br /><br />HEAT: High and low settings both dry my hair well. Usually I start with high and then switch to low when I only have a few spots left to dry. Does not overheat. With my old hair dryer, I would have to press the cool button after a couple moments in the high setting because it heated up too much. I have not had that problem with this hair dryer. The low setting is a bit slow (~10 min) to dry my shoulder length hair completely, so I never use only the low setting unless I have to.<br /><br />SMELL: Good. No smell. Other hair dryers sometimes smell burnt, but this one does not.<br /><br />SHINE/SOFTNESS: I think my hair is shiny and soft, but I do not know how much to attribute to the hair drier and how much to attribute to conditioners and other things. Anyway, this hair dryer does not make my hair frizzy. No frizziness! It leaves it smooth.<br /><br />RECOMMEND? Yes!

  780. Bought this dryer for my girlfriend as a Christmas gift. She has very thick hair and has complained about previous dryers not getting hot enough or blowing the air hard enough to get her hair completely dry, however this is not a problem when using the Revlon dryer. On a side note I would also take into account several reviews from individuals with thinner hair saying this dryer gets too hot, and can damage hair if not used properly. Overall this is an awesome dryer for the price, I would highly recommend this for people with normal to thick hair.

It dried my hair in half the time and at was light enough that I didn't get my normal arm and neck strain. Amazing little machine for the price!

The other attachment focuses the airstream with presicion brush during styling.
  786. I can't believe how light this dryer is! It is so quiet that it makes my old dryer sounded like a semi truck. LOL I have used the dryer and find that it does not blow more than it dries, like other dryiers. That makes it much easier on hair. I have never used hair dryer attachments and probably won't use the ones that came with this one. So, I can't help you there. When you first use it, remember to depress the red button on the cord. It will not turn on, unless you do this. You only have to do this once. It is a safety feature. If you have small children, you can disable the red button, so kids won't turn it on and leave it. Remember, it is very quiet. Overall I am happy with this purchase.

My hair generally looks shiny on it's own, is stick straight, but has NO volume or bounce. I turned it on the \\"high\\" and \\"warm\\" setting to get it 80% dry, then put the concentrator on and turned it down to \\"low\\" (it was drying too fast!) to finish. I use a 3 1/2 inch Marilyn Tuxedo brush to finish drying in sections, concentrating at roots and ends. <br /> <br />I would definitely recommend trying this dryer before forking over $300 for the T3 or another model. Considering how much I spent on it, I assumed it would last much longer. So having learned my lesson when it comes to hair dryers (the most expensive ones are necessarily the best ones), I wanted to make sure I made a smarter investment. Before my Solia blow dryer, I had used a Conair one and a Revlon one so I wanted to decide between the two. I had tried a brand new Conair Infinity that was 1800W and was incredibly disappointed by its power and heat capacity, so I decided to go with Revlon and chose this model based on the reviews. I've only been using it for a couple of weeks, but I think it has just as much power as my old Solia blow dryer for a fraction of the price. So far, its made me regret spending more than $80 on a blow dryer in the past when this one was less than $20. The real question will be longevity, but honestly at this price point, I would be happy if it lasted me a year.

I was searching for an inexpensive tourmaline ionic dryer after my, rather pricey, T3 short circuited :(. This one definitely does the job without damaging my hair. It's inexpensive at a mere $20 and I can't complain. I do wish that the cord retracted or at least came with a velcro strap for streamlined packing when traveling. It is a medium-size dryer. Not at all a travel-size but not overly cumbersome that it would be a stretch to pack it. I also can't help wishing it was a bit more powerful, but for $20 (once again) I can't complain. It also comes with different fixtures that I, being the hair simpleton that I am, do not use. Always nice to have the option. The dryer also has warm/hot/cool/low/high settings. Great for basic needs.
  902. This hair dryer reduced the time it took me greatly. However, I don't find it as quiet as what's advertised. Mine is still pretty loud. I love to listen to music while showering and getting ready and this drowns out the music. Worth it though since it takes less than 10 minutes to dry my hair.
  903. I like it, it has nice low settings so I can dry my dog after I bathe him but it's hard to hold the handle without accidentally pushing buttons.
  904. It's ok. Dries the hair, nice settings, but I don't see the ionic results compared to other dryers. For the cost its worth it, but the results are not what I was looking for.
  905. Works SOOO much better than my old hair dryer in that my thick, long hair dries before my arms feel like they are going to fall off.
  906. Bought this mainly for those days where I actually have the time to blow dry and straighten my hair. I have moderately curly hair (type 2C or 3A) but usually just let it air dry because it always takes too long to blow dry and straighten. This dryer with the condenser attachment and a large round brush actually made pretty easy work of a home blow out. I don't have a lot of practice but it took about 30 min to blow dry and straighten my low back length hair (usually took about hour with my old hair dryer). The cord was plenty long and didn't require any awkward maneuvering. I have gotten a lot of compliments on the results and most people thought I'd gone to a salon and gotten it done professionally. I haven't had a chance to use the diffuser yet but would definitely recommend this for anyone looking to straighten their long curly hair at home.
  907. This is actually the best hair-dryer I've owned to date. I can't believe the quality of this product compared to its price. I love it so much I'd pay for it $50.00 and over if I had to, because that's what it's worth to me. I have arm's length un-processed hair. It takes me about 20-25 minutes to dry my hair with my old hair dryer, and about 30-35 minutes with styling. This little handy machine dries my hair in LITERALLY 10 minutes !!! And 15-20 minutes with styling (depends on how much I want to style my hair). Not only that: my hair doesn't feel dry and coarse. Instead, it feels smooth and silky! Like I said, I can't believe a product of this quality being sold for ONLY $15-$20. Should it ever break, I'll be ordering the exact same one again. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED if you don't have a lot of time every day to dry/style your hair. It's also great for travelling as it's very small and light. Love it.

  941. I can't afford the $200+ price tag of some of the other hair dryers, so I tried this one instead. I was surprised at how good it was in comparison. My very thick, shoulder-length hair was dry in less than 10 minutes - my former dryer took 20 - and it was smooth, shiny and sleek. Other dryers made my hair puff out like a pyramid, and lifted every split end. It's very light. My hair with this dryer looks fantastic. I wish I had switched long ago. Drawbacks? It's a little loud, the switches turn off easily when you're holding the handle, and the hot setting is really hot. But all of these things are minor complaints and worth dealing with. So, if you don't have $200 to spend on a hair dryer (who does?), get this one. It's 90% as good as the top-end ones, the extra 10% better isn't even that noticeable, and your hair will look fantastic.

  1014. The product itself is fine however when you pay good money for something, you expect it to be complete. I received the hair dryer today and I was missing the Concentrator attachment.   1015. *UPDATED REVIEW* I would not recommend buying this hair dryer. I had used it over for over a year with no issues and I loved it because it dried my hair so quickly. BUT a couple days ago I was drying my hair, had been using the hair dryer for about 2 minutes, when all of the sudden sparks started shooting out of the handle of the dryer (where I was holding it) and I dropped it on the floor and quickly unplugged it. There didn't appear to be a fire, but I was freaked out and immediately threw it in the garbage can. I just went back to read other 1 star reviews and see that other people have had the same issue, so I'm wondering if there was a recall for this product that we all aren't aware of.

  1043. I've only used this dryer with the diffuser since I never heat-straighten my hair. I have 3c/4a hair, it's about bra-strap length when stretched. Overall, I don't feel like this dryer fits my needs and will probably return it.<br /><br />Pros: I do like how light and small the dryer is, especially for a tourmaline ionic ceramic dryer. It's also inexpensive for a name brand dryer, especially if you have, like I do, a Prime membership. The diffuser is larger than others I've used so it really preserved my curls with minimal frizz.<br /><br />Cons: as other reviewers mention, the placement of the buttons is *very* distracting and it's difficult to not accidentally turn it off or change the heat settings. The main reason it doesn't work is that, with the diffuser, the air is too cool on hot setting. Frankly, I didn't notice much of a difference between hot and warm settings. In about 30 minutes, I was only able to get about 80% of my hair dry (and it hadn't been sopping wet).<br /><br />So...can this dryer handle my curls? That'll be a no. On to try another!
  1044. I have thick curly hair that, without a dryer, can take upwards of 4 hours to dry. This hairdryer is the answer. It leaves my hair frizz free, the diffuser dries quickly and evenly. Keep in mind I was always gentle with the cord (not wrapping it around and around). I know this is a cheap dryer, but honestly, it seems ridiculous to buy a dryer and only expect to get a year's use out of it. It's wasteful that my 1 year old dryer is now in a dump somewhere.<br /><br />This is a good dryer, and if it were double, even triple the cost, and was better built, I'd be so happy. There's no reason this couldn't be a more sturdy product.

The air flow is sufficient, and the heat is not too hot so it burns but hot enough it dries quickly. I've noticed a lot less frizz in my curly hair and my best friend borrowed it and she has super fine straight hair and had it blow dry smooth without any static when she borrowed it.<br /><br />If I had but one complaint, and it's really a minor one: the product 'feels' cheap. i worry a little bit that it's not going to be sturdy over the long haul if I drop it or knock it around.<br /><br />Other than that, I like how it looks, it's light enough it's easy to hold, and I like how it works.   1073. I have used this hair dryer about 10 times so far and I have to say. It is an amazing bang for your buck! I mainly got it as a back up dryer and then began my search for a high quality dryer in the $80-$100 price range. I tried Solia 1875 ionic and the Rusk Speed Freak so far and both of them paled in comparison to this one. It only has two heat settings but the high heat is perfect (not too hot, but not warm either). This dryer is tourmaline & ceramic and I found i had more body and the same amount of shine with this one as I did with the Solia but the Solia made my hair very flat. Not so with this dryer. My hair has great body and doesn't get stringy or greasy the next day. THe Rusk dried my hair to shreds (can you say horse hair???) and caused a lot of breakage. I am sending both the high priced dryers back whence they came and keeping this one and will buy a 2nd one as a backup and I still saved about 50%! Thanks Revlon & Thanks Amazon! :)<br /><br />Update: I still like this product but it didn't really calm my damaged broken bangs. It left them frizzy and I think was contributing to the damage. Every time I dried my hair my broken bangs would fly all over the place and stick up horribly. I ended up buying a Babyliss 6600 dryer from Amazon and will use this as a backup. It is very lightweight but I dont think it will hold up well. Stick to Babyliss (more money but worth it if you have damaged, fragile hair).

  1097. I’m always in search of a hair dryer that can blow dry my thick, curly hair as well as my stylist does. (I know … I know … it’s the person not the tool.) When she dries it, she barely has to touch it up with a flat iron. When I dry it … I have to do a little more work to straighten out the wavy stragglers.<br /><br />This review compares the Remington Damage Control (DC) Ceramic Hair Dryer, Remington T|Studio Silk AC Professional Hair Dryer, and this one (Revlon 1875W Tourmaline Ionic Ceramic Dryer,).<br /><br />All of them have:<br /> * Same wattage<br /> * Three heat settings<br /> * Two speed settings<br /> * Cool shot feature<br /> * Diffuser and concentrator attachments<br /> * Ionic technology<br /> * Ceramic technology<br /> * Hanging loop<br /><br />The Revlon does not come with a removable filter, the two Remingtons do. (The TStudio doesn’t say it on the box or description. Company website confirms it.) Revlon and Remington Damage Control have tourmaline technology, the TStudio does not.<br /><br />The Revlon’s concentrator attachment stays on. The Remington’s fall off often. If I put the dryer down to adjust my hair, it comes off some of the time. It's hot to put it back on.<br /><br />All three take about the same time to dry my hair. I may have gotten slightly better results (less wavy) with the Remingtons than with the Revlon. I say “may” because the difference wasn’t large enough to be clear. Some days I do a better job than others. Human error, you know.<br /><br />The Damage Control felt like it took less effort and the reason is most likely because it’s the lightest of the three. The shell of the DC and Revlon are plastic while the T|Studio uses better quality materials. But it could be the better quality materials that make it heavier.<br /><br />I can only assume the DC is cheaper than the T|Studio because of its plastic shell even though it has tourmaline technology, which the T|Studio does not.<br /><br />I’ve yet to try the diffusers. Whenever I wear my hair curly, I let it dry naturally. That’s the whole point of going curly – not having to do any hair drying. As for noise – I can’t answer which one is quietest because I’m deaf. It’s not a good idea to wear hearing aids while drying wet hair. :)<br /><br />The winner? The Remington DC because it takes the least amount of effort to use and produces the same results as the others. The T|Studio is just too heavy and the Revlon doesn’t perform as well as the DC.<br /><br />Updated 29 Nov 2016: This is the second hairdryer as the first one lasted only eight months. The company replaced it. And now the second one died within two years. (Warranty is 24 months.) Time to find another brand.henever I wear my hair curly, I let it dry naturally. That’s the whole point of going curly – not having to do any hair drying. As for noise – I can’t answer which one is quietest because I’m deaf. It’s not a good idea to wear hearing aids while drying wet hair. :)<br /><br />The winner? The Remington DC because it takes the least amount of effort to use and produces the same results as the others. The T|Studio is just too heavy and the Revlon doesn’t perform as well as the DC.<br /><br />Updated 29 Nov 2016: This is the second hairdryer as the first one lasted only eight months. The company replaced it. And now the second one died within two years. (Warranty is 24 months.) Time to find another brand.
  1098. I have had two of these dryers. While the price is great, and the dryer itself works well, they eventually failed where the cord attaches to the handle. First the dryer stopped working intermittently while in use, because the cord bent a certain way. I had to hold the cord while drying to keep the dryer working. After several months of this, the cord started shooting sparks where it attaches to the handle. At that point, I unplugged and got rid of the dryer. This happened with both of my Revlon dryers. I did not wrap the cords tightly around the dryer handle to store, so I think this is a faulty design and a major weakness. I would say each dryer lasted maybe 3-4 years. Again, a good price for the amount of years, but I don't like when sparks fly from my hair dryer.

  1116. I bought one for myself three years ago, then when my mother's broke last year, I got the same one for her for Christmas. She loves it. Very happy with the noise level.<br /><br />Plus it dries hair fast! I do have fine thin shoulder length hair, so it didn't take too long prior to dry, but I have cut my time in 1/2. I gave it four stars because I am concerned about its longevity; it just doesn't feel super solidly made and not being subjected to turn off the ions.   1210. I bought two of these (I have 3 females with long hair in the house) on October 4, 2013. Neither made it 6 months, On one the motor started running slow after 3 months. I sent an email to Revlon only to be told I needed to contact another company (Helen of Troy [...]) for any issues. The second one just failed 5/1/2014, It started cutting on and off. After inspection, one of cables in the power cord had started to separate (not a short, actually starting to break) near the handle. This pretty much tell me that they used too small of a gauge wire to support the load. The built in GFCI will not protect anyone from this. If your hand is one the cord and it breaks (burns through) get ready to electrocuted. And for those who don't understand, yes that can kill you, 1875W/120V=15.625A plenty enough to blow your heart to shreds if the circuit is completed across your body. If you don't mind accidental death then this is the product for you. I bought these based on reviews, but from my point of view they should be recalled and the customer should be refunded.

So I apparently will get a physical check some time in the near future.<br />Overall it's a fine dryer but I'm surprised Revlon will ruin their good name by forcing customers into this strange and inconvenient warranty process.

I was in the market for a new hair dryer and talking to a coworker about it, the next day she brought her's in (which was the Revlon RV544PKF) and said take it home and use it this weekend and let me know what you think. So I did and WOW! I thought I had a decent hair dryer before but this hair dryer was amazing. I have thick long hair and with my old dryer it took about 35 minutes to dry, now that time has been cut in half. It has a few settings high and low, and warm and hot- it's just enough. The tourmaline technology my hair feels healthier than ever. You can't beat this hair dryer at this price.
  1377. I can't say anything exceptional about this dryer, but I had the Revlon folding one which worked way better than this one did. However, the cool shot button on this works great! It's a hair dryer, what else can I say - nothing extraordinary. But I do not notice any static after blow drying my hair like some other dryers. This is a good thing!
  1378. This works great! This is the first blower dryer I have bought in years and I am very pleased with this one! I will buy it again.
  1379. Delivery was fast. The hair drier is good and works perfect. No problems at all
  1380. This hairdryer is cheap- you get what you pay for. Mine went out in a few months due to loose connections. I do not recommend.
  1381. Not as quiet as my old one but works well
  1382. I have had this hair dryer for about 2 months now..and I still love it! It's quieter than the last one I had, and I love the many settings you can choose. I don't get dry hair in 10 minutes as others report, but it might be due to the porosity of my hair, since I love to color it. But that's okay, it dries WAY faster than the other one I threw out...and I appreciate being to put it on lower heat if need be to be heat-gentle on the hair!
  1383. This hair drier does dry hair pretty fast. It has a focused jet of air that does not get very hot. It works well on both my short hair and my wife's long, thick hair.<br /><br />This drier looks nice with silver and black being so much better than the ridiculous pink and purple colors used on some other models. The noise is reasonable, and you can always use the low setting if you want to make it quieter. The unit is light and has a 6 foot long cord.<br /><br />My only complaint is that the \\"on\\" rocker switch is the bottom switch when you would expect it to be on top. I think the \\"ionic\\" thing is just a marketing gimmick, but it does not hurt to have it.
  1384. bought this for my wife and she loved it. it got mw lucky .0)
  1385. I have extremely naturally curly hair and the diffuser is wonderful! It dries my hair in about 10 minutes instead of waiting half the day for it to air dry. The best part is it doesn't make my hair too frizzy.
  1386. It's relatively quiet, on the low setting. Lightweight and effective. I was skeptical of the &#34;ionic&#34; claim, which does not make scientific sense to me; but for some reason my hair seems to be silkier than it was with my old dryer.
  1387. This is a small lightweight powerful unit. My wife has long hair and this makes quick work of drying all that hair when needed. No complaints!
  1388. It's useful. Good for dry hair, not too strong. The only problem is the concentration is too long for personal use. Sometimes it hits my head.

  1418. We needed a new dryer as our old one of 10 plus years stopped working. Based on other reviews, I purchased this dryer. It is fairly light and comfortable to use. The low and high speeds seem adequate but my wife feels that our old dryer had a stronger high speed. The heat settings also seem adequate. I use low and warm but my wife uses the high speed and the hot setting. I don't see any &#34;frizzies&#34; when I dry my hair. I don't find this dryer to be as quiet as I hoped for although it is somewhat quieter than my old dryer. I have heard other dryers that only seem to produce the sound of air while this dryer produces a slight whine at the low speed and a louder whine at the high speed. All in all, it does the job for which it is intended. I hope we get as many years out of this one as we did our old one.<br />P.S.I was very diligent keeping the air intake free of dust which will kill a dryer and I will do the same with this one.This is an important step in the longevity of the dryer.

  1428. I also have a professional BaByliss Turbo hair dryer ($200). I bought this Revlon model because I wanted a lightweight spare for travelling. I've compared the two on a very thick head of hair. The BaByliss is quieter, hotter, and blows with more velocity. It comes with a nice long cord. It dried a full head of long hair in 5 minutes. This Revlon model is quieter than a generic Conair dryer, but I wouldn't say it's super quiet. It get's hot enough, and has adequate velocity. It is definitely lightweight. Nonetheless, the Revlon dried the same head of hair in 6 minutes, with similar \\"ionic\\" results. Overall, hey - you get what you pay for. But, for $25 this hair dryer is an excellent value. It does the job very well. I'm going to buy another one for a gift. I'm fairly impressed with it (given the low cost).

However, what both dryers did that I can't forgive is SPARK and develop scary lawnmower sounds after about a year of use. I can use them both on the low setting (which is too low to actually accomplish anything), but the moment I press the &#34;high&#34; switch, it sounds like there's a chainsaw in my hair (which, frankly, is the last thing I want by my head).<br /><br />Conclusion: Invest in a more expensive dryer, or risk setting your head on fire.

I hope you can do something to replace this defective hairdryer! And yes, I am meticulous in making sure there is no buildup in the hairdryer that would have contributed to this. We are lucky she wasn't seriously electrocuted! UPDATE: We contacted Revlon customer service who handled this very well. It is powerful enough to dry my shoulder length hair fairly quickly. I think it has been better than my old dryer at taming flyways, but it could also be the better shampoo I started using. I use the dryer often on high heat, full power to dry my hair all over. I also make liberal use of the small directional attachment to concentrate the air on my brush as I am brushing it out.   1475. It was a crisp sunny day. It was one of those rare warm pre-spring days when everyone is taking their dogs on their (once) annual walks. Naturally, dog owners need a beer to quench their post-walk thirst. I am no different. So we saunter into a down bar. Initially we are greeted with the statement that dogs are not allowed. Alas, I am prepared for this. Using my cleverly counterfeited dog assistant card, I convince the manager to either let Mr. Beagle in or let me call the Department of Justice. Said manager relented, and my dog was given leave to wander the watering hole.<br /><br />As we wander about the watering hole, a particular waitress and Mr. Beagle hit it off. I waited for him to get done and then cleaned up the scraps. We agreed to go watch movies at my place. I was particularly proud of my new theater room with the new sofa in it. Looks pretty dang nice. We watched approximately 8 minutes of a nature documentary before I tried to get to fifth or sixth base. Everything is going fine. Then BAMMMMMMMMMMMM. This crazy chick asks me to pour wax on her. it gets all over the sofa and the carpet. WTF am I gonna do? For at least a month, the answer was nothing. Then I ordered this freaking hair dryer and it melted the wax. Now I have a good looking couch again. Thanks, hair dryer.<br /><br />P.S. I never actually dried hair this with. I would not recommend it for that. This device is clearly designed for wax melting.
